My tendency to try to apply Western revisions to Japanese practices is a
long standing habit of my own frequently causing me to receive a whack over
the head with a shinai.  One sensei liked to describe me as a "mouth bushi,"
i.e. a pejorative term for the sort of person who talks about the do,
instead of simply accepting and following instructions.
